contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2012}} {{Infobox Australian place | type = town | name = Yilliminning | image = | caption = | lga = Shire of Narrogin | latd =32 |latm =54|lats =00 | longd =117|longm =22 |longs =00 | est = 1907 | postcode = 6312 | pop = 337 (2006 Census)<ref name=Census2006Y /> | dist1 = 212 | dir1 = SE | location1 = [[Perth, Western Australia|Perth]] | dist2 = 20 | dir2 = ENE | location2 = [[Narrogin, Western Australia|Narrogin]] | fedgov = [[Division of O'Connor|O'Connor]] | stategov = [[Electoral district of Wagin|Wagin]] | state = wa }} '''Yilliminning''' is a small town located in the southern [[Wheatbelt (Western Australia)|Wheatbelt]] region of [[Western Australia]], {{convert|212|km|mi|0}} southeast of the state capital, [[Perth, Western Australia|Perth]] and 20 kilometres {{convert|13|km|mi|1}} east of [[Narrogin, Western Australia|Narrogin]]. At the 2006 [[Census in Australia|census]], Yilliminning had a population of 337.<ref name=Census2006Y>{{Census 2006 AUS|id=SSC56156|name=Yilliminning (State Suburb) |accessdate=25 July 2011|quick=on}}</ref> ==History== The name Yilliminning is of [[Indigenous Australians|Aboriginal]] origin, derived from a rock, pool and river of the same name nearby, and was first recorded in 1892. It originally had one "n", but was amended in 1944 after years of confusion about the spelling. In 1906, the Minister for Lands visited the area, and local settlers sought his support for the declaration of a townsite. Land was set aside, a hall was erected, and lots were surveyed. The townsite of Yillimining was gazetted in July 1907, but no lots were sold due to doubts about the future of the townsite because it wasn't on the route of a proposed new railway between Narrogin (on the [[Great Southern Railway (Western Australia)|Great Southern Railway]] and [[Wickepin, Western Australia|Wickepin]] to the northeast. In 1909 the government constructed the new railway line west of the townsite, and established Yillimining Siding 5 kilometres west of the townsite. Demand for a new townsite to be declared arose, and the new townsite (called Yillimining) was gazetted in 1910, with the old one being cancelled.<ref>{{LandInfo WA|c|Y|2007-03-25}}</ref> In 2012 [[CBH Group]] named its first grain haulage [[CBH class]] locomotive after the location. ==References== {{reflist}} {{Towns Wheatbelt South WA}} [[Category:Towns in Western Australia]] [[Category:Australian Aboriginal place names]] [[Category:Wheatbelt (Western Australia)]] {{WesternAustralia-geo-stub}}
